alert.note: Alert for Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:22PM CDT until June 22 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN WHEELER...SOUTHEASTERN GRAY...COLLINGSWORTH AND NORTHEASTERN DONLEY COUNTIES... At 422 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles southeast of Mclean, or 17 miles west of Shamrock, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Shamrock, Mclean, Dodson, Lutie, Dozier, Lela and Samnorwood. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
